summary: Main text is a copy of the Latin version of Bede’s Historia ecclesiastica. Cædmon’s Hymn is on a tab, attached to the margin later, probably in the main text hand. Place of production not known.

items.locus: fol. 82v, a tab, attached to the outer margin

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (fol. 82v a tab, attached to the outer margin) Ny ƿe sceolan herian heo | fonrices ƿeard. metudes mihte | beginning of line missing, probably ' ˥ / and' his modgeþanc. ƿeorc ƿulder fæ | der. Sƿa he ƿundra gepart illegible, probably 'hƿæs ece | drihten

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (fol. 82v a tab, attached to the outer margin) þa he ærest sceop eorðe | bearnum heofon to hrofe. þa mid | dangeard moncynnes ƿeard ece | drihten æfter teide fyrum on | folden frea ælmihtig halig scyp | peod

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson with the assistance of Sanne van der Schee, with reference to published scholarship.
